result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric L. Vanremortel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: To pay the costs of the action. 60 days to pay costs or set up payment plan with the Clerk of Courts office.
Huber release and good time granted. 60 days to report. Credit for time served to be determined by the Jail.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eric L. Vanremortel

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Voir dire list, random listing report, juror selection and peremptroy challenges, jury seating chart, jury sign in sheet.
Curative instruction defense is requesting at trial.

Defendant Eric L. Vanremortel in court with attorney Eric S. Maciolek.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews preliminary matters with counsel. Court addresses State's Motion in Limine. State indicates they have #1 worked out. #2 - in agreement. Defense Motion in Limine - State/Defense in agreement. Recess. Back in session. Discussion regarding exhibit Defense may use at trial. Court won't allow that exhibit into evidence. Voir dire begins. Oath of Qualification given. Oath of Trial Panel given. Recess 9:45 am. Back in session 10:02 am. State/Defense give opening statements. Testimony taken from DOC Agents Jackie Scholten, Kim Bridenhagen, Sara Siefert, sworn. Cross, redirect. Recess 11:04 am. Back in session 11:16 am. Katie Stiel testifies, sworn. Cross, redirect.  Officer Dan Pellizzer testifies, sworn. Cross, redirect. Officer Robert Osborne testifies, sworn. Cross, redirect. State rests. Defense has no witnesses. Jury excused for lunch. Court questions defendant on his right not to testify. Defendant indicates he will not be testifying. Court questions defendant, finds defendant is freely, knowingly & voluntarily waiving his right to testify. Court reviews jury instructions and verdict forms with counsel. Recess 11:55 am. Back in session 12:59 pm. Court gives preliminary instructions. State/Defense give closing arguments. State gives rebuttal argument. Court gives final instructions. Oath of Bailiff given. Jury to deliberations 1:41 pm. Back in session 1:53 pm. Jury returns with verdict. Jury finds defendant guilty of Disorderly Conduct. Court polls jury. Jury excused. State requests judgment on verdict. Court finds defendant guilty of Disorderly Conduct. State gives sentencing recommendation. Defense gives sentencing argument. Defendant makes statement to the court.  Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.

Defendant Eric L. Vanremortel in court with attorney Eric S. Maciolek.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Maciolek ready to proceed to trial on 9/15/15. Court indicates this matter is in the #1 position. Atty Maciolek to let court know by Friday, 9/11/15 at noon if matter has settled. Bond remains in effect.
from Atty Maciolek regarding possible conflict with jury date. Also requests pretrial be moved to morning of 8/31/15 because of a conflict in the afternoon. Court moves hearing to 11:15 am.
from ADA Korb requesting to reschedule 8/26/15 jury trial as Agent Kim Bridenhagen is not available that day. Court reschedules.

Defendant Eric L. Vanremortel in court with attorney Eric S. Maciolek.  Defendant Eric L. Vanremortel in custody.  Joan Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, questions Atty Maciolek on where matter is at. Atty Maciolek indicates matter is proceeding to trial as of right now. Court advises matter is still in the #2 position on the trial calendar. ADA Korb indicates she has a 2 day jury trial in Br. 2 on June 16 & 17 and that trial is going, this trial, if moved into #1 position will have to be rescheduled. Court will reschedule trial. Bond remains in effect.

Defendant Eric L. Vanremortel in court with attorney Eric S. Maciolek who appears by phone .  Defendant Eric L. Vanremortel in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file, questions counsel where matter is at.  Atty Maciolek indicates matter will be proceeding to trial after receiving new offer from the State. Atty Maciolek asks Court to move 6/08/15 pretrial as he has a conflict. Court reschedules pretrial to 5/29/15 at 10:30 AM. State indicates they will be filing some motions prior to pretrial date. Court will address motions on 5/29/15. Bond remains in effect.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Eric L. Vanremortel in court with attorney Eric S. Maciolek.  Defendant Eric L. Vanremortel in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Maciolek advises the case is not resolved, asks court to set matter for pretrial and trial.  Set for pretrial and trial. Bond remains in effect.

Defendant Eric L. Vanremortel in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Defendant Eric L. Vanremortel in custody.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel. Defense waives reading of the complaint, enters not guilty plea. Court finds probable cause for bindover. Bond set.  Status conference scheduled for April 13, 2015 at 11:30 am.
Defendant was fingerprinted 1/29/15 by jail staff.  (fingerprint card destroyed 9/15/15)
